result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda J. Zagrzebski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation revoked:
*Huber priviliges for work or any counseling she may be involved in
*First 5 months in jail and the second 4 months on GPS electronic home monitoring, if approved by jail administration and risk assessment

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Maintain full-time employment. (10-13-17: Court removes the condition of obtain and maintain full-time employment).

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any dangerous weapons

*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol
*Complete a mental health assessment and comply with recommendations
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA sample 
*No contact either direct or indirect with E Schmidt

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from DOC

Defendant Amanda J. Zagrzebski in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Jazgar is also present.

11:38 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Court received a memo from the agent indicating that Defendant is not complying with some of the conditions that the Court ordered.
Court questions the agent regarding community service. Agent replies.

Defendant addresses the Court regarding the community service at the parks department.
Court questions Defendant for clarifications.

Atty Redfield takes a moment to re-read the memo.

11:41 AM Atty Zell addresses the Court. 

Defendant states that restitution and court fees have been paid.
Agent states that Defendant still owes restitution, a portion has been paid.
$536.97 - restitution that came out of the bond
$1,000 cash bond - used for restitution, restitution surcharge and court costs

Court reviews the file - a payment was made yesterday, paying off balance. 

Discussions continue among parties.

Issue is obtaining and maintaining full time employment.
Agent addresses the Court, Defendant does not work full time.
Court questions Defendant.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court regarding Defendant's son and employment.

11:49 AM J Zagrzebski is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
11:55 PM Cross-examination by Atty Zell.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court will delete condition of probation: obtain and maintain full time employment.
Probation will continue.
Probation review hearing on October 13, 2017 at 11:15 am.
Disbursements Journal Final

Defendant Amanda J. Zagrzebski in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:23 a.m.  Court calls the case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification; no victim appears in Court today.
**VICTIM IS IN AGREEMENT WITH THIS PLEA AGREEMENT REACHED BY ALL PARTIES
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1, 2 & 4 and Count 3, 5 & 6 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 9 month jail sentence
23 days jail credit
If probation is revoked, huber priviliges for work or counseling she may be involved in
First 5 months in jail and the second 4 months on GPS electronic home monitoring if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Complete a mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.
Maintain full time employment
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Provide DNA Sample
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.
Pay restitution in the amount of $536.97 to B Wiza
No contact either direct or indirect with E Schmidt 

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 9 month jail sentence - Concurrent to Count 1 
23 days jail credit
If probation is revoked, huber priviliges for work or counseling she may be involved in
First 5 months in jail and the second 4 months on GPS electronic home monitoring if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

Count 3 - DRI

Count 4 -
Impose/Stay 9 month jail sentence - Concurrent to Count 1 & 2
23 days jail credit
If probation is revoked, huber priviliges for work or counseling she may be involved in
First 5 months in jail and the second 4 months on GPS electronic home monitoring if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent
**Conditions of Probation:

Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI

Defendant Amanda J. Zagrzebski in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter is set for a plea today.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, has had intense conversations with the State.

Court informs Atty Redfield as to procedure he must follow from here on out with regards to taking a trial off the calendar.

Atty Redfield understands.
 
Jury trial has been set.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
